name: 2dcat
author: AFNI Team
description: Assembles a set of images into an image matrix (IM) montage of NX by NY images.

inputs.description: Input image files
inputs.name: Input files

inputs.description: Multiply each image IM(i,j) in output image matrix IM by the color or intensity of the pixel (i,j) in SCALE_IMG.
inputs.name: Scale image

inputs.description: Multiply each pixel (i,j) in output image by the color or intensity of the pixel (i,j) in SCALE_IMG. SCALE_IMG is automatically resized to the resolution of the output image.
inputs.name: Scale pixels

inputs.description: Instead of multiplying by the color of pixel (i,j), use its intensity (average color).
inputs.name: Scale intensity flag

inputs.description: Apply FAC in addition to scaling of -scale_* options.
inputs.name: Global scale factor

inputs.description: Force output to be in RGB, even if input is bytes. This option is turned on automatically in certain cases.
inputs.name: RGB output flag

inputs.description: Set resolution of all input images to RX by RY pixels. Default is to make all input have the same resolution as the first image.
inputs.name: Input resolution

inputs.description: Like -res_in, but resample to the max while respecting the aspect ratio, and then pad to achieve desired pixel count.
inputs.name: Input resolution with padding

inputs.description: Set the padding value, should it be needed by -respad_in to VAL. VAL is typecast to byte, default is 0, max is 255.
inputs.name: Padding value

inputs.description: Crop images by L (Left), R (Right), T (Top), B (Bottom) pixels. Cutting is performed after any resolution change, if any, is to be done.
inputs.name: Crop parameters

inputs.description: A line is eliminated if none of its R G B values differ by more than CTOL% from those of the corner pixel.
inputs.name: Autocrop color tolerance

inputs.description: A line is eliminated if none of its R G B values differ by more than ATOL% from those of line average.
inputs.name: Autocrop average tolerance

inputs.description: This option is the same as using both of -autocrop_atol 20 and -autocrop_ctol 20
inputs.name: Autocrop flag

inputs.description: If number of images is not enough to fill matrix solid black images are used.
inputs.name: Zero wrap flag

inputs.description: If number of images is not enough to fill matrix solid white images are used.
inputs.name: White wrap flag

inputs.description: If number of images is not enough to fill matrix, solid gray images are used. GRAY must be between 0 and 1.0.
inputs.name: Gray wrap value

inputs.description: If number of images is not enough to fill matrix, images on command line are reused (default).
inputs.name: Image wrap flag

inputs.description: When reusing images to fill matrix, randomize the order in refill section only.
inputs.name: Random wrap flag

inputs.description: Prefix the output files with string 'ppp'.
inputs.name: Prefix

inputs.description: Specify number of images in each row and column of IM at the same time.
inputs.name: Matrix dimensions

inputs.description: Number of images in each row.
inputs.name: Number of rows

inputs.description: Number of images in each column.
inputs.name: Number of columns

inputs.description: Set NX and NY to be the same as the SCALE_IMG's dimensions. (needs -scale_image)
inputs.name: Matrix from scale flag

inputs.description: Put a line G pixels wide between images.
inputs.name: Gap width

inputs.description: Set color of line to R G B values. Values range between 0 and 255.
inputs.name: Gap color
